cyclone.name: CHRIS
cyclone.current_location: about 145 miles SSE of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Meandering just off the North Carolina coast through the weekend with a turn toward the northeast away from the U.S. coast by Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: None – system forecast to remain offshore the Carolinas

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coasts of North Carolina and the Mid-Atlantic states will experience increased surf and rip currents
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with a 9% cumulative chance of tropical-storm-force winds (most likely below 39 mph).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; only elevated surf and rip currents forecast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Scattered heavy showers possible, generally 1–3 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along nearby beaches.
